definition: balance, to hold or carry in equilibrium
examples: carried a water jar poised on her head

definition: to hold supported or suspended without motion in a steady position
examples: poised her fork and gave her guest a knowing look

definition: to hold or carry (the head) in a particular way
to become drawn up into readiness

examples: a poise between widely divergent impulses

definition: easy self-possessed assurance of manner : gracious tact in coping or handling, the pleasantly tranquil interaction between persons of poise
examples: no angry outbursts marred the poise of the meeting

definition: a particular way of carrying oneself : bearing, carriage

a centimeter-gram-second unit of viscosity equal to the viscosity of a fluid that would require a shearing force of one dyne to impart to a one-square-centimeter area of an arbitrary layer of the fluid a velocity of one centimeter per second relative to another layer separated from the first by a distance of one centimeter
